application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Construction of a lower ground floor rear extension, demolition of existing outbuilding & construction of new outbuilding (within the rootzone of a TPO tree), and construction of a new bin and bike shed to the front of the property. A new window in the rear of the outrigger. Removal of a Silver Birch tree within the front yard. New side access gate from Gayhurst Road.
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-16d1e19d-7fff-0c5f-4f45-994e3c88ec13"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">A scheme for the provision and implementation of flood resilient and resistant construction details and measures for the rear extension against surface water flood risk shall be submitted to and agreed, in writing with the LPA in consultation with the LLFA prior to the construction of the measures. The scheme shall be carried out in its entirety before the extension is occupied and; constructed and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with current best practices.</span></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-16d1e19d-7fff-0c5f-4f45-994e3c88ec13"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"><span id="docs-internal-guid-cebac886-7fff-4d36-9f98-0c15d1f15797"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: In the interests of prevention of surface water flood risk at lower ground floor level. </span></span><br></span></span><br></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Details to be approved and implemented â€“ Sash Windows</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any work is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved which shall be implemented in full prior to the first occupation/use of the development.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">&nbsp;i) Details of the proposed sash window in the outrigger in the form of 1:10 horizontal and vertical section drawings of details showing the material, profile and dimensions of the glazing bars at their junction with the glazing units; the location and depth of the glazing units; the sash boxes with weights, pulleys and cords.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-889ef562-7fff-adca-9ccd-38f004913c10"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that the special architectural and historic interest of this building is safeguarded and that the proposal does not detract from the character and appearance of the Conservation Area.</span></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Tree protection for all retained trees at the site and on adjacent land shall be undertaken in accordance with the tree protection measures as set out in the Arboriculturall report (Ref BS 5837), dated 02/12/2020, for the duration of all site works undertaken in connection with the removal of the shed and construction of the outbuilding hereby approved.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"><br></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: In order to protect the TPO protected Sycamore tree during building operation and site works.</span></p><p><b style="font-weight:normal;" id="docs-internal-guid-7852a28b-7fff-59c6-3a5b-1adde599896f"><br></b></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><br></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-ea55b120-7fff-ecd1-4537-b58adc37677a"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification and a drainage layout of at least one suitable sustainable drainage systems (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving, etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</span></span></p><p>REASON: In the interests of prevention of exacerbation of surface water flood risk to adjoining land.<br></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline;">Materials:</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Works above ground level shall not commence until details of all materials to be used on the external surfaces of the buildings (including rear extension, bin store, outbuilding, fences, bin store and paint colour) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved, and shall be maintained as such thereafter.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f2030096-7fff-8560-5c2e-8dfe24701fbb"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the development is satisfactory, and preserves or enhances the character and appearance of the Graham Road and Mapledene Conservation Area.</span></p>
